intro: Arctotis semipapposa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces vibrant blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
